channel.title: Blog on Alexander Soto | Bridging Social Justice and Technology
channel.description: Recent content in Blog on Alexander Soto | Bridging Social Justice and Technology

item.title: Starting Graduate School
item.description: I'm currently a graduate student at Northeastern University and I'm part of the ALIGN program pursuing a master's in Computer Science. The ALIGN program are a series of bridge courses for students that in their undergraduate studies didn't major in Computer Science. Upon completion of the ALIGN program students take graduate level classes in computer science. I'm currently taking my first ALIGN course, CS5001 or "fundies" as it's called at Northeastern University.

item.title: Concepts, Techniques, and Models of Computer Programming
Humble Beginnings
item.description: My beginnings with technology starts in early childhood. During the weekends I visited my father and spent most of the time with my brother Robinson. Robinson, an electrical engineer from Dominican Republic, was my mentor and role-model. When I visited during the weekend I would find my brother taking apart and repairing different devices. I looked forward to spending time with him and I would ask questions about technology, such as "
